title: Add public "LOVE THE LIQUID" Ko-fi monetization page

requirements.summary: Create a new public "LOVE THE LIQUID" page with a prominent title and embedded Ko-fi view.
acceptanceCriteria: A new React page component exists for the monetization page and renders a visible H1 title "LOVE THE LIQUID".
The page embeds the Ko-fi destination https://ko-fi.com/painparadise directly within the page content (e.g., via iframe/embed), and the embed loads without crashing the app.
The page is accessible without requiring authentication (consistent with existing public pages like Tips/Facts).

file_operations.description: Create a new public page component rendering an H1 "LOVE THE LIQUID" and an embedded view of https://ko-fi.com/painparadise (e.g., responsive iframe with safe sandbox/referrer policy). Use existing shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card) to match app styling—Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a clear call-to-action button on the "LOVE THE LIQUID" page linking to Ko-fi.
acceptanceCriteria: A button is visible on the "LOVE THE LIQUID" page and uses English user-facing text.
Clicking the button opens https://ko-fi.com/painparadise (preferably in a new tab using safe link attributes).

file_operations.description: Add a prominent call-to-action button with English text that links to https://ko-fi.com/painparadise and opens in a new tab with safe rel attributes. Compose using the existing shadcn-ui Button component—Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Register a lazy-loaded TanStack Router route for the new "LOVE THE LIQUID" page at a stable path.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating directly to the new route path renders the "LOVE THE LIQUID" page.
The new page is lazy-loaded similarly to existing routes (e.g., Tips/Facts) and does not increase initial bundle unnecessarily.

file_operations.description: Add a lazy import for LoveTheLiquidPage and register a new TanStack Router route at a stable, human-readable path like "/love-the-liquid", included in the routeTree alongside existing lazy-loaded pages.

requirements.summary: Add navigation links to the "LOVE THE LIQUID" page in both desktop header nav and mobile menu.
acceptanceCriteria: Desktop header shows a nav link that routes to the "LOVE THE LIQUID" page.
Mobile menu shows a nav link that routes to the "LOVE THE LIQUID" page and closes the menu when clicked.

file_operations.description: Add a new desktop header navigation <Link> entry labeled "LOVE THE LIQUID" pointing to "/love-the-liquid" and keep it visible for unauthenticated users (like Tips/Facts).
Add a new mobile menu <Link> entry labeled "LOVE THE LIQUID" pointing to "/love-the-liquid" and ensure it calls onClose when clicked (consistent with other mobile links).
